reviewText: Really basic gameplay without the variety or addicitive quality that I like in overhead shooters.  The characters look good from far away which is what's important I suppose but up close they look like they're meant for the original playstation.  It ran well on my midrange machine but I guess that's to be expected for a game that looks like it was mean tfor the first iphone.\n\nKindof fun but gets boring fast.  Much better options for this type of game.
voteText: 14 of 23 people (61%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Well, I've played a few levels and I have to say, although this game is pretty simple and a bit repetitive, it's still quite a bit of fun.  Not much variety of enemies or the environment (so far anyway) but it's fun collecting stuff to buy upgrades with.  I do wish that more health would be available during the levels but it seems to be a fairly rare drop - I end up spending parts to replenish my health when I could be using it for more upgrades.  At any rate, it's a fun little time-killer of a game so I give it a thumbs-up.

reviewText:
Worth playing if you love simple shooters with lots of nice fx. The gameplay stays pretty fun for an indie game.

PROS:
-Upgrades and weapons are cool.
-Art has a nice style.
-Animation is solid.
-Great flashy effects.
-Music works well.


CONS:
-Story is fairly standard.
-Feels a bit repetitive at times (What game doesn't nowdays).
-No Multiplayer.


7/10

reviewText:
It is a yes because there is no option to say whatever on Steam.

Basic shooter with a story which lacks of some development and good playtesting.  My main reproach is the lack of knowing where the character is aiming probably in relation with the top 3D view and the character movement.

The game also seems to get boring pretty fast... Run around, some stuff to shoot, keep going without much more to do and intereactivity with the surrounding.

For cheap (like in the current Indiegala weekly bundle), you may want to give a try, otherwise probably stay away or get ready to go with the Steam refund process.

reviewText:
3.8/10 - Not terrible but not worth a thumbs up!

It's a pretty basic top down shooter, it has a pretty cool 3D vibe to the game and the controls are decent. The real problem is the gameplay; it's quite boring! There aren't enough monsters or additional things to do in this massive map. You spend most of your time running around looking for more stuff to kill...

Good story and intro movie, but the gameplay didn't live up to the initial start. There are only 2 modes which include Survival and Story Mode; these are essentially the exact same and feel quite repetitive. This game desperately needed a multiplayer mode; it would have changed my whole outlook on the game.

The game is much more fun if you use a controller so I highly suggest trying that; I was able to utilize my Steam Controller which really pleases me. You will have to set up the controller yourself since this game may never have a community uploaded preset.

Not worth the heavy $8 price tag. I'd pay $0.99 if there much better multiplayer twin shooters.

reviewText: I'm generally a fan of this type of game, but this is no Hotline miami or even Hatred.  The AI is basically nonexistant and its hard to tell where your bullets will go due to the skewed perspective and lack of a crosshair.\n\nThe graphics are colorful at least but plays more like a timewasting minigame than a full title.  Where's the depth?
